gnutls_x509_crt_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_init (gnutls_x509_crt_t *cert);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize an X.509 certificate structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_crt_deinit (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a CRL structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded Certificate to the native gnutls_x509_crt_t format. The output will be stored in cert.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CERTIFICATE", or "CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed certificate.
The DER or PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_list_import ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_list_import (gnutls_x509_crt_t *certs, unsigned int *cert_max, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given PEM encoded certificate list to the native gnutls_x509_crt_t format. The output will be stored in certs. They will be automatically initialized.
If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CERTIFICATE", or "CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: The structures to store the parsed certificate. Must not be initialized.
Initially must hold the maximum number of certs. It will be updated with the number of certs available.
The PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM.
must be zero or an OR'd sequence of gnutls_certificate_import_flags.
the number of certificates read or a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_export (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the certificate to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN CERTIFICATE".

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a certificate PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative value will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the Certificate issuer in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC2253. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the OIDs of the name of the Certificate issuer specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the Certificate issuer specified by the given OID. The output, if the raw flag is not used, will be encoded as described in RFC2253. Thus a string that is ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is zero, this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC2253 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use zero to get the first one.
If non zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the Certificate in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC2253. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the OIDs of the name of the Certificate subject specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the Certificate subject specified by the given OID. The output, if the raw flag is not used, will be encoded as described in RFC2253. Thus a string that is ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is zero, this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC2253 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use zero to get the first one.
If non zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer where the DN part will be copied (may be null).
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_check_hostname ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_check_hostname (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *hostname);
refsect2.para: This function will check if the given certificate's subject matches the given hostname. This is a basic implementation of the matching described in RFC2818 (HTTPS), which takes into account wildcards, and the DNSName/IPAddress subject alternative name PKIX extension.

listitem.simpara: should contain an gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
A null terminated string that contains a DNS name
non zero for a successful match, and zero on failure.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return a value of the gnutls_sign_algorithm_t enumeration that is the signature algorithm.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a gnutls_sign_algorithm_t value, or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_signature ()
refsect2.para: This function will extract the signature field of a certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
a pointer where the signature part will be copied (may be null).
initially holds the size of sig
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_version (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return the version of the specified Certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
version of certificate, or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int flags, unsigned char *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will return a unique ID the depends on the public key parameters. This ID can be used in checking whether a certificate corresponds to the given private key.

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned. The output will normally be a SHA-1 hash output, which is 20 bytes.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
should be 0 for now
will contain the key ID
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
In case of failure a negative value will be returned, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_authority_key_id ()

refsect2.para: This function will set the X.509 certificate's authority key ID extension. Only the keyIdentifier field can be set with this function.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The key ID
Holds the size of the serial field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509v3 certificate authority's key identifier. This is obtained by the X.509 Authority Key identifier extension field (2.5.29.35). Note that this function only returns the keyIdentifier field of the extension.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_crl_dist_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_crl_dist_points (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *reason_flags, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the CRL distribution points (2.5.29.31), contained in the given certificate.

reason_flags should be an ORed sequence of GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_UNUSED, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_KEY_COMPROMISE, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CA_COMPROMISE, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_AFFILIATION_CHANGED, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_SUPERSEEDED, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CESSATION_OF_OPERATION, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_CERTIFICATE_HOLD, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_PRIVILEGE_WITHDRAWN, GNUTLS_CRL_REASON_AA_COMPROMISE, or zero for all possible reasons.
This is specified in X509v3 Certificate Extensions. GNUTLS will return the distribution point type, or a negative error code on error.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the distribution point (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the distribution point will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
Revocation reasons flags.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER and updates &ret_size if &ret_size is not enough to hold the distribution point, or the type of the distribution point if everything was ok. The type is one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_crl_dist_points2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_crl_dist_points2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t type, const void *data, unsigned int data_size, unsigned int reason_flags);
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL distribution points certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is one of the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t enumerations
The data to be set
The data size
revocation reasons
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_crl_dist_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_crl_dist_points (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t type, const void *data_string, unsigned int reason_flags);
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL distribution points certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is one of the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t enumerations
The data to be set
revocation reasons
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_cpy_crl_dist_points ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_cpy_crl_dist_points (gnutls_x509_crt_t dst, gnutls_x509_crt_t src);
refsect2.para: This function will copy the CRL distribution points certificate extension, from the source to the destination certificate. This may be useful to copy from a CA certificate to issued ones.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
the certificate where the dist points will be copied from
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_activation_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crt_get_activation_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time this Certificate was or will be activated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
activation time, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_expiration_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crt_get_expiration_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time this Certificate was or will be expired.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
expiration time, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_serial ()
refsect2.para: This function will return the X.509 certificate's serial number. This is obtained by the X509 Certificate serialNumber field. Serial is not always a 32 or 64bit number. Some CAs use large serial numbers, thus it may be wise to handle it as something opaque.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
The place where the serial number will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *bits);
refsect2.para: This function will return the public key algorithm of an X.509 certificate.
If bits is non null, it should have enough size to hold the parameters size in bits. For RSA the bits returned is the modulus. For DSA the bits returned are of the public exponent.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
if bits is non null it will hold the size of the parameters' in bits
a member of the gnutls_pk_algorithm_t enumeration on success, or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_rsa_raw ()
refsect2.para: This function will export the RSA public key's parameters found in the given structure. The new parameters will be allocated using gnutls_malloc() and will be stored in the appropriate datum.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
will hold the modulus
will hold the public exponent
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_dsa_raw ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_pk_dsa_raw (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_datum_t *p, gnutls_datum_t *q, gnutls_datum_t *g, gnutls_datum_t *y);
refsect2.para: This function will export the DSA public key's parameters found in the given certificate. The new parameters will be allocated using gnutls_malloc() and will be stored in the appropriate datum.

listitem.simpara: Holds the certificate
will hold the p
will hold the q
will hold the g
will hold the y
GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS on success, otherwise an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the alternative names, contained in the given certificate.
This is specified in X509v3 Certificate Extensions. GNUTLS will return the Alternative name (2.5.29.17), or a negative error code.

When the SAN type is otherName, it will extract the data in the otherName's value field, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME is returned. You may use gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid() to get the corresponding OID and the "virtual" SAN types (e.g., GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP).

If an otherName OID is known, the data will be decoded. Otherwise the returned data will be DER encoded, and you will have to decode it yourself. Currently, only the RFC 3920 id-on-xmppAddr SAN is recognized.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *ret_type, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the alternative names, contained in the given certificate. It is the same as gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name() except for the fact that it will return the type of the alternative name in ret_type even if the function fails for some reason (i.e. the buffer provided is not enough).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the alternative name will be copied to
holds the size of ret.
holds the type of the alternative name (one of gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t).
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_othername_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int seq, void *ret, size_t *ret_size);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the type OID of an otherName Subject Alternative Name, contained in the given certificate, and return the type as an enumerated element.
This function is only useful if gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name() returned GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
specifies the sequence number of the alt name (0 for the first one, 1 for the second etc.)
is the place where the otherName OID will be copied to
holds the size of ret.

the alternative subject name type on success, one of the enumerated gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t. For supported OIDs, it will return one of the virtual (GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_*) types, e.g. GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME_XMPP, and GNUTLS_SAN_OTHERNAME for unknown OIDs. It will return GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if ret_size is not large enough to hold the value. In that case ret_size will be updated with the required size. If the certificate does not have an Alternative name with the specified sequence number and with the otherName type then GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_ca_status ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_ca_status (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return certificates CA status, by reading the basicConstraints X.509 extension (2.5.29.19). If the certificate is a CA a positive value will be returned, or zero if the certificate does not have CA flag set.
Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints() if you want to read the pathLenConstraint field too.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical
A negative value may be returned in case of parsing error. If the certificate does not contain the basicConstraints extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_basic_constraints (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical, int *ca, int *pathlen);
refsect2.para: This function will read the certificate's basic constraints, and return the certificates CA status. It reads the basicConstraints X.509 extension (2.5.29.19).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical
pointer to output integer indicating CA status, may be NULL, value is 1 if the certificate CA flag is set, 0 otherwise.
pointer to output integer indicating path length (may be NULL), non-negative values indicate a present pathLenConstraint field and the actual value, -1 indicate that the field is absent.

If the certificate is a CA a positive value will be returned, or zero if the certificate does not have CA flag set. A negative value may be returned in case of errors. If the certificate does not contain the basicConstraints extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_usage ()
refsect2.para: This function will return certificate's key usage, by reading the keyUsage X.509 extension (2.5.29.15). The key usage value will ORed values of the: GNUTLS_KEY_DIGITAL_SIGNATURE, GNUTLS_KEY_NON_REPUDIATION, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_DATA_ENCIPHERMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_AGREEMENT, GNUTLS_KEY_KEY_CERT_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_CRL_SIGN, GNUTLS_KEY_ENCIPHER_ONLY, GNUTLS_KEY_DECIPHER_ONLY.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
where the key usage bits will be stored
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical
the certificate key usage, or a negative value in case of parsing error. If the certificate does not contain the keyUsage extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_key_usage ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_key_usage (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int usage);
refsect2.para: This function will set the keyUsage certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
an ORed sequence of the GNUTLS_KEY_* elements.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_proxy ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_proxy (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, unsigned int *critical, int *pathlen, char **policyLanguage, char **policy, size_t *sizeof_policy);
refsect2.para: This function will get information from a proxy certificate. It reads the ProxyCertInfo X.509 extension (1.3.6.1.5.5.7.1.14).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical
pointer to output integer indicating path length (may be NULL), non-negative values indicate a present pCPathLenConstraint field and the actual value, -1 indicate that the field is absent.
output variable with OID of policy language
output variable with policy data
output variable size of policy data
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known (const char *oid);
refsect2.para: This function will inform about known DN OIDs. This is useful since functions like gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid() use the information on known OIDs to properly encode their input. Object Identifiers that are not known are not encoded by these functions, and their input is stored directly into the ASN.1 structure. In that case of unknown OIDs, you have the responsibility of DER encoding your data.

listitem.simpara: holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
1 on known OIDs and 0 otherwise.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the certificate. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const char *oid, int indx, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the extension specified by the OID in the certificate. The extensions will be returned as binary data DER encoded, in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the extensions, this specifies which to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned. If the certificate does not contain the specified extension GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the certificate, and the critical flag for it. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data() to extract the data.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *sizeof_oid is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_data (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension data in the certificate. The extension data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_info() to extract the OID and critical flag. Use gnutls_x509_crt_get_extension_by_oid() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the extension OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned. If you have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_extension_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_extension_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, const char *oid, const void *buf, size_t sizeof_buf, unsigned int critical);
refsect2.para: This function will set an the extension, by the specified OID, in the certificate. The extension data should be binary data DER encoded.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
a pointer to a DER encoded data
holds the size of buf
should be non zero if the extension is to be marked as critical
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, const char *oid, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *name, unsigned int sizeof_name);
refsect2.para: This function will set the part of the name of the Certificate subject, specified by the given OID. The input string should be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h With this function you can only set the known OIDs. You can test for known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known(). For OIDs that are not known (by gnutls) you should properly DER encode your data, and call this function with raw_flag set.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
must be 0, or 1 if the data are DER encoded
a pointer to the name
holds the size of name
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_issuer_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, const char *oid, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *name, unsigned int sizeof_name);
refsect2.para: This function will set the part of the name of the Certificate issuer, specified by the given OID. The input string should be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h With this function you can only set the known OIDs. You can test for known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known(). For OIDs that are not known (by gnutls) you should properly DER encode your data, and call this function with raw_flag set.
Normally you do not need to call this function, since the signing operation will copy the signer's name as the issuer of the certificate.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds an Object Identifier in a null terminated string
must be 0, or 1 if the data are DER encoded
a pointer to the name
holds the size of name
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_version (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int version);
refsect2.para: This function will set the version of the certificate. This must be one for X.509 version 1, and so on. Plain certificates without extensions must have version set to one.

To create well-formed certificates, you must specify version 3 if you use any certificate extensions. Extensions are created by functions such as gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alt_name() or gnutls_x509_crt_set_key_usage().

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds the version number. For X.509v1 certificates must be 1.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_key ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_key (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_privkey_t key);
refsect2.para: This function will set the public parameters from the given private key to the certificate. Only RSA keys are currently supported.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
holds a private key
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_ca_status ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_ca_status (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int ca);
refsect2.para: This function will set the basicConstraints certificate extension. Use gnutls_x509_crt_set_basic_constraints() if you want to control the pathLenConstraint field too.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
true(1) or false(0). Depending on the Certificate authority status.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_basic_constraints ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_basic_constraints (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, unsigned int ca, int pathLenConstraint);
refsect2.para: This function will set the basicConstraints certificate extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
true(1) or false(0). Depending on the Certificate authority status.
non-negative values indicate maximum length of path, and negative values indicate that the pathLenConstraints field should not be present.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alternative_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alternative_name (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t type, const char *data_string);
refsect2.para: This function will set the subject alternative name certificate extension. This function assumes that data can be expressed as a null terminated string.
The name of the function is unfortunate since it is incosistent with gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject_alt_name().

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is one of the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t enumerations
The data to be set, a zero terminated string
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alt_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_alt_name (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t type, const void *data, unsigned int data_size, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will set the subject alternative name certificate extension. It can set the following types:
&GNUTLS_SAN_DNSNAME: as a text string
&GNUTLS_SAN_RFC822NAME: as a text string
&GNUTLS_SAN_URI: as a text string
&GNUTLS_SAN_IPADDRESS: as a binary IP address (4 or 16 bytes)
Other values can be set as binary values with the proper DER encoding.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is one of the gnutls_x509_subject_alt_name_t enumerations
The data to be set
The size of data to be set
GNUTLS_FSAN_SET to clear previous data or GNUTLS_FSAN_APPEND to append.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_sign ()
refsect2.para: This function is the same a gnutls_x509_crt_sign2() with no flags, and SHA1 as the hash algorithm.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is the certificate of the certificate issuer
holds the issuer's private key
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_sign2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_sign2 (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer, gnutls_x509_privkey_t issuer_key, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t dig, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will sign the certificate with the issuer's private key, and will copy the issuer's information into the certificate.
This must be the last step in a certificate generation since all the previously set parameters are now signed.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
is the certificate of the certificate issuer
holds the issuer's private key
The message digest to use, GNUTLS_DIG_SHA1 is a safe choice
must be 0
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_activation_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_activation_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, time_t act_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this Certificate was or will be activated.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_expiration_time ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_expiration_time (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, time_t exp_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this Certificate will expire.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_serial ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the X.509 certificate's serial number. Serial is not always a 32 or 64bit number. Some CAs use large serial numbers, thus it may be wise to handle it as something opaque.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The serial number
Holds the size of the serial field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_subject_key_id ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the X.509 certificate's subject key ID extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
The key ID
Holds the size of the serial field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_proxy_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_proxy_dn (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, gnutls_x509_crt_t eecrt, unsigned int raw_flag, const void *name, unsigned int sizeof_name);
refsect2.para: This function will set the subject in crt to the end entity's eecrt subject name, and add a single Common Name component name of size sizeof_name. This corresponds to the required proxy certificate naming style. Note that if name is NULL, you MUST set it later by using gnutls_x509_crt_set_dn_by_oid() or similar.

listitem.simpara: a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure with the new proxy cert
the end entity certificate that will be issuing the proxy
must be 0, or 1 if the CN is DER encoded
a pointer to the CN name, may be NULL (but MUST then be added later)
holds the size of name
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_proxy ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_set_proxy (gnutls_x509_crt_t crt, int pathLenConstraint, const char *policyLanguage, const char *policy, size_t sizeof_policy);
refsect2.para: This function will set the proxyCertInfo extension.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
non-negative values indicate maximum length of path, and negative values indicate that the pathLenConstraints field should not be present.
OID describing the language of policy.
opaque byte array with policy language, can be NULL
size of policy.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_print ()
refsect2.para: This function will pretty print a X.509 certificate, suitable for display to a human.

If the format is GNUTLS_CRT_PRINT_FULL then all fields of the certificate will be output, on multiple lines. The GNUTLS_CRT_PRINT_ONELINE format will generate one line with some selected fields, which is useful for logging purposes.
The output out needs to be deallocate using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: The structure to be printed
Indicate the format to use
Newly allocated datum with zero terminated string.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_print ()
refsect2.para: This function will pretty print a X.509 certificate revocation list, suitable for display to a human.
The output out needs to be deallocate using gnutls_free().

listitem.simpara: The structure to be printed
Indicate the format to use
Newly allocated datum with zero terminated string.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_issuer_dn (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_datum_t *start);
refsect2.para: This function will return a pointer to the DER encoded DN structure and the length.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will hold the starting point of the DN
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_dn ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_raw_dn (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_datum_t *start);
refsect2.para: This function will return a pointer to the DER encoded DN structure and the length.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
will hold the starting point of the DN
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_rdn_get ()
refsect2.para: This function will return the name of the given RDN sequence. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC2253.

listitem.simpara: should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, or GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned and *sizeof_buf is updated if the provided buffer is not long enough, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_rdn_get_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_rdn_get_oid (const gnutls_datum_t *idn, int indx, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will return the specified Object identifier, of the RDN sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
Indicates which OID to return. Use 0 for the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name OID
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, or GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned and *sizeof_buf is updated if the provided buffer is not long enough, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_rdn_get_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_rdn_get_by_oid (const gnutls_datum_t *idn, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will return the name of the given Object identifier, of the RDN sequence. The name will be encoded using the rules from RFC2253.

listitem.simpara: should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
an Object Identifier
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN indicates which to send. Use 0 for the first one.
If non zero then the raw DER data are returned.
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name
holds the size of buf
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, or GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned and *sizeof_buf is updated if the provided buffer is not long enough, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef void *gnutls_x509_dn_t;

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_subject (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: Return the Certificate's Subject DN as an opaque data type. You may use gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava() to decode the DN.
Note that dn should be treated as constant. Because points into the cert object, you may not deallocate cert and continue to access dn.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
output variable with pointer to opaque DN.
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_issuer (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: Return the Certificate's Issuer DN as an opaque data type. You may use gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava() to decode the DN.
Note that dn should be treated as constant. Because points into the cert object, you may not deallocate cert and continue to access dn.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
output variable with pointer to opaque DN
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, int irdn, int iava, gnutls_x509_ava_st *ava);
refsect2.para: Get pointers to data within the DN.

Note that ava will contain pointers into the dn structure, so you should not modify any data or deallocate it. Note also that the DN in turn points into the original certificate structure, and thus you may not deallocate the certificate and continue to access dn.

listitem.simpara: input variable with opaque DN pointer
index of RDN
index of AVA.
Pointer to structure which will hold output information.
Returns 0 on success, or an error code.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_init (gnutls_x509_dn_t *dn);
refsect2.para: This function initializes a gnutls_x509_dn_t structure.
The object returned must be deallocated using gnutls_x509_dn_deinit().

listitem.simpara: the object to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_import ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_import (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, const gnutls_datum_t *data);
refsect2.para: This function parses an RDN sequence and stores the result to a gnutls_x509_dn_t structure. The structure must have been initialized with gnutls_x509_dn_init(). You may use gnutls_x509_dn_get_rdn_ava() to decode the DN.

listitem.simpara: the structure that will hold the imported DN
should contain a DER encoded RDN sequence
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_dn_export (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the DN to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN NAME".

listitem.simpara: Holds the opaque DN object
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a DN PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_dn_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_dn_deinit (gnutls_x509_dn_t dn);
refsect2.para: This function deallocates the DN object as returned by gnutls_x509_dn_import().

listitem.simpara: a DN opaque object pointer.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_init (gnutls_x509_crl_t *crl);
refsect2.para: This function will initialize a CRL structure. CRL stands for Certificate Revocation List. A revocation list usually contains lists of certificate serial numbers that have been revoked by an Authority. The revocation lists are always signed with the authority's private key.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_deinit ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnutls_x509_crl_deinit (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will deinitialize a CRL structure.

listitem.simpara: The structure to be initialized

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded CRL to the native gnutls_x509_crl_t format. The output will be stored in 'crl'.
If the CRL is PEM encoded it should have a header of "X509 CRL".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed CRL.
The DER or PEM encoded CRL.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_export (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);
refsect2.para: This function will export the revocation list to DER or PEM format.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN X509 CRL".

listitem.simpara: Holds the revocation list
the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a private key PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative value on failure.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn ()
refsect2.para: This function will copy the name of the CRL issuer in the provided buffer. The name will be in the form "C=xxxx,O=yyyy,CN=zzzz" as described in RFC2253. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.
If buf is NULL then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn_by_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_issuer_dn_by_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const char *oid, int indx, unsigned int raw_flag, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the part of the name of the CRL issuer specified by the given OID. The output will be encoded as described in RFC2253. The output string will be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded, depending on the certificate data.

Some helper macros with popular OIDs can be found in gnutls/x509.h If raw flag is zero, this function will only return known OIDs as text. Other OIDs will be DER encoded, as described in RFC2253 -- in hex format with a '#' prefix. You can check about known OIDs using gnutls_x509_dn_oid_known().
If buf is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
holds an Object Identified in null terminated string
In case multiple same OIDs exist in the RDN, this specifies which to send. Use zero to get the first one.
If non zero returns the raw DER data of the DN part.
a pointer to a structure to hold the peer's name (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size, and 0 on success.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_dn_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_dn_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the requested OID of the name of the CRL issuer, specified by the given index.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which DN OID to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the name (may be null)
initially holds the size of 'oid'
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_signature_algorithm ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_signature_algorithm (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return a value of the gnutls_sign_algorithm_t enumeration that is the signature algorithm.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_signature ()
refsect2.para: This function will extract the signature field of a CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
a pointer where the signature part will be copied (may be null).
initially holds the size of sig
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_version (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the version of the specified CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The version number, or a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_this_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crl_get_this_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time this CRL was issued.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
when the CRL was issued, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_next_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: time_t gnutls_x509_crl_get_next_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the time the next CRL will be issued. This field is optional in a CRL so it might be normal to get an error instead.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
when the next CRL will be issued, or (time_t)-1 on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl);
refsect2.para: This function will return the number of revoked certificates in the given CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
number of certificates, a negative value on failure.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, unsigned char *serial, size_t *serial_size, time_t *t);
refsect2.para: This function will retrieve the serial number of the specified, by the index, revoked certificate.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
the index of the certificate to extract (starting from 0)
where the serial number will be copied
initially holds the size of serial
if non null, will hold the time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. and a negative value on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate_count
refsect2.programlisting: #define gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate_count gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_count

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate
refsect2.programlisting: #define gnutls_x509_crl_get_certificate gnutls_x509_crl_get_crt_serial

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_check_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_check_issuer (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer);
refsect2.para: This function will check if the given CRL was issued by the given issuer certificate. It will return true (1) if the given CRL was issued by the given issuer, and false (0) if not.

listitem.simpara: is the CRL to be checked
is the certificate of a possible issuer
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_version (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, unsigned int version);
refsect2.para: This function will set the version of the CRL. This must be one for CRL version 1, and so on. The CRLs generated by gnutls should have a version number of 2.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
holds the version number. For CRLv1 crls must be 1.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_sign ()
refsect2.para: This function is the same a gnutls_x509_crl_sign2() with no flags, and SHA1 as the hash algorithm.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
is the certificate of the certificate issuer
holds the issuer's private key
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_sign2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_sign2 (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer, gnutls_x509_privkey_t issuer_key, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t dig, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will sign the CRL with the issuer's private key, and will copy the issuer's information into the CRL.
This must be the last step in a certificate CRL since all the previously set parameters are now signed.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
is the certificate of the certificate issuer
holds the issuer's private key
The message digest to use. GNUTLS_DIG_SHA1 is the safe choice unless you know what you're doing.
must be 0
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_this_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_this_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, time_t act_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this CRL was issued.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_next_update ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_next_update (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, time_t exp_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set the time this CRL will be updated.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The actual time
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt_serial ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt_serial (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const void *serial, size_t serial_size, time_t revocation_time);
refsect2.para: This function will set a revoked certificate's serial number to the CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The revoked certificate's serial number
Holds the size of the serial field.
The time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_crt ()
refsect2.para: This function will set a revoked certificate's serial number to the CRL.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t with the revoked certificate
The time this certificate was revoked
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the CRL authority's key identifier. This is obtained by the X.509 Authority Key identifier extension field (2.5.29.35). Note that this function only returns the keyIdentifier field of the extension.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The place where the identifier will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_number ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_number (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, void *ret, size_t *ret_size, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the CRL number extension. This is obtained by the CRL Number extension field (2.5.29.20).

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
The place where the number will be copied
Holds the size of the result field.
will be non zero if the extension is marked as critical (may be null)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_oid (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the CRL. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send, use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative value in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension OID in the CRL, and the critical flag for it. The extension OID will be stored as a string in the provided buffer. Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data() to extract the data.
If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *sizeof_oid is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send, use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the OID
initially holds the maximum size of oid, on return holds actual size of oid.
output variable with critical flag, may be NULL.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative value in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_data (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, int indx, void *data, size_t *sizeof_data);
refsect2.para: This function will return the requested extension data in the CRL. The extension data will be stored as a string in the provided buffer.

Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_info() to extract the OID and critical flag. Use gnutls_x509_crl_get_extension_by_oid() instead, if you want to get data indexed by the extension OID rather than sequence.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crl_t structure
Specifies which extension OID to send. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a structure to hold the data (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative value in case of an error. If your have reached the last extension available GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_authority_key_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_set_authority_key_id (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const void *id, size_t id_size);
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL's authority key ID extension. Only the keyIdentifier field can be set with this function.

listitem.simpara: a CRL of type gnutls_x509_crl_t
The key ID
Holds the size of the serial field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_set_number ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the CRL's number extension.

listitem.simpara: a CRL of type gnutls_x509_crl_t
The CRL number
Holds the size of the nr field.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8.0

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded PKCS7 to the native gnutls_pkcs7_t format. The output will be stored in 'pkcs7'.
If the PKCS7 is PEM encoded it should have a header of "PKCS7".

The DER or PEM encoded PKCS7.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_export ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_pkcs7_export (gnutls_pkcs7_t pkcs7, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, void *output_data, size_t *output_data_size);

If the buffer provided is not long enough to hold the output, then *output_data_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER will be returned.
If the structure is PEM encoded, it will have a header of "BEGIN PKCS7".

the format of output params. One of PEM or DER.
will contain a structure PEM or DER encoded
holds the size of output_data (and will be replaced by the actual size of parameters)
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

After the last certificate has been read GNUTLS_E_REQUESTED_DATA_NOT_AVAILABLE will be returned.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_pkcs7_t structure
contains the index of the certificate to extract
the contents of the certificate will be copied there (may be null)
should hold the size of the certificate
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value. If the provided buffer is not long enough, then certificate_size is updated and GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_pkcs7_set_crt_raw ()

the DER encoded certificate to be added

the certificate to be copied.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

the index of the certificate to delete
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

the index of the crl to delete
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: enum gnutls_certificate_verify_flags
gnutls_x509_crt_check_issuer ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_check_issuer (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_x509_crt_t issuer);
refsect2.para: This function will check if the given certificate was issued by the given issuer.

listitem.simpara: is the certificate to be checked
is the certificate of a possible issuer
It will return true (1) if the given certificate is issued by the given issuer, and false (0) if not. A negative value is returned in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify (const gnutls_x509_crt_t *cert_list, int cert_list_length, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *CA_list, int CA_list_length, const gnutls_x509_crl_t *CRL_list, int CRL_list_length, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given certificate list and return its status. If no flags are specified (0), this function will use the basicConstraints (2.5.29.19) PKIX extension. This means that only a certificate authority is allowed to sign a certificate.
You must also check the peer's name in order to check if the verified certificate belongs to the actual peer.

The certificate verification output will be put in verify and will be one or more of the gnutls_certificate_status_t enumerated elements bitwise or'd. For a more detailed verification status use gnutls_x509_crt_verify() per list element.
GNUTLS_CERT_INVALID: the certificate chain is not valid.
GNUTLS_CERT_REVOKED: a certificate in the chain has been revoked.

listitem.simpara: is the certificate list to be verified
holds the number of certificate in cert_list
is the CA list which will be used in verification
holds the number of CA certificate in CA_list
holds a list of CRLs.
the length of CRL list.
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the certificate verification output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_verify (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *CA_list, int CA_list_length, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given certificate and return its status. The verification output in this functions cannot be GNUTLS_CERT_NOT_VALID.

listitem.simpara: is the certificate to be verified
is one certificate that is considered to be trusted one
holds the number of CA certificate in CA_list
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the certificate verification output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.and a negative value in case of an error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crl_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crl_verify (gnutls_x509_crl_t crl, const gnutls_x509_crt_t *CA_list, int CA_list_length, unsigned int flags, unsigned int *verify);
refsect2.para: This function will try to verify the given crl and return its status. See gnutls_x509_crt_list_verify() for a detailed description of return values.

listitem.simpara: is the crl to be verified
is a certificate list that is considered to be trusted one
holds the number of CA certificates in CA_list
Flags that may be used to change the verification algorithm. Use OR of the gnutls_certificate_verify_flags enumerations.
will hold the crl verification output.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_check_revocation ()
refsect2.para: This function will return check if the given certificate is revoked. It is assumed that the CRLs have been verified before.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
should contain a list of gnutls_x509_crl_t structures
the length of the crl_list
0 if the certificate is NOT revoked, and 1 if it is. A negative value is returned on error.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_fingerprint ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_fingerprint (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, gnutls_digest_algorithm_t algo, void *buf, size_t *sizeof_buf);
refsect2.para: This function will calculate and copy the certificate's fingerprint in the provided buffer.
If the buffer is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
is a digest algorithm
a pointer to a structure to hold the fingerprint (may be null)
initially holds the size of buf
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_buf will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_purpose_oid ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_crt_get_key_purpose_oid (gnutls_x509_crt_t cert, int indx, void *oid, size_t *sizeof_oid, unsigned int *critical);
refsect2.para: This function will extract the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate specified by the given index. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37) See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.
If oid is null then only the size will be filled.

listitem.simpara: should contain a gnutls_x509_crt_t structure
This specifies which OID to return. Use zero to get the first one.
a pointer to a buffer to hold the OID (may be null)
initially holds the size of oid
output flag to indicate criticality of extension
GNUTLS_E_SHORT_MEMORY_BUFFER if the provided buffer is not long enough, and in that case the *sizeof_oid will be updated with the required size. On success 0 is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_crt_set_key_purpose_oid ()
refsect2.para: This function will set the key purpose OIDs of the Certificate. These are stored in the Extended Key Usage extension (2.5.29.37) See the GNUTLS_KP_* definitions for human readable names.
Subsequent calls to this function will append OIDs to the OID list.

listitem.simpara: a certificate of type gnutls_x509_crt_t
a pointer to a null terminated string that holds the OID
Whether this extension will be critical or not
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS (zero) is returned, otherwise an error code is returned.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import ()
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded key to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format. The output will be stored in key .
If the key is PEM encoded it should have a header of "RSA PRIVATE KEY", or "DSA PRIVATE KEY".

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded certificate.
One of DER or PEM
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.title: gnutls_x509_privkey_import_pkcs8 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_import_pkcs8 (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, const gnutls_datum_t *data, gnutls_x509_crt_fmt_t format, const char *password, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: This function will convert the given DER or PEM encoded PKCS8 2.0 encrypted key to the native gnutls_x509_privkey_t format. The output will be stored in key. Both RSA and DSA keys can be imported, and flags can only be used to indicate an unencrypted key.
The password can be either ASCII or UTF-8 in the default PBES2 encryption schemas, or ASCII for the PKCS12 schemas.

If the Certificate is PEM encoded it should have a header of "ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY", or "PRIVATE KEY". You only need to specify the flags if the key is DER encoded, since in that case the encryption status cannot be auto-detected.

listitem.simpara: The structure to store the parsed key
The DER or PEM encoded key.
One of DER or PEM
the password to decrypt the key (if it is encrypted).
0 if encrypted or GNUTLS_PKCS_PLAIN if not encrypted.
On success, GNUTLS_E_SUCCESS is returned, otherwise a negative error value.

refsect2.programlisting: int gnutls_x509_privkey_import_rsa_raw (gnutls_x509_privkey_t key, const gnutls_datum_t *m, const gnutls_datum_t *e, const gnutls_datum_t *d, const gnutls_datum_t *p, const gnutls_datum_t *q, const gnutls_datum_t *u);

holds the private exponent
holds the first prime (p)
holds the second prime (q)
holds the coefficient
